Articles.Content:
So Bob's returning from high above the sun with a science load, and we happened to look out the Mk1 command pod window and see a nice conjunction of Kerbin and Mun. I remember Mr. Manley saying you can zoom way in from the window view so I double left clicked the command pod window, realized my mistake and right clicked to zoom. I then noticed I could see Minmus as well. (top of image)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=313549108

Then I found I could rotate the camera all the way around and look a Kerbal in the eye!?

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=313549957

Oh, and I saw it on Reddit first.

Wish the official Forum got more love.
I'm sure you've always been able to "get out of your seat," but the bit where you can look all the way back the Kerbal is puzzling me. It could be a bug, it could be a hidden feature.
watch this be the one hidden feature of .25 that they decided to add in .24 just to mess with us
I always thought that was impossible without the secret NumPad Shift hotkey.
Yeah u could do this for a long time.
This has been done before. Here's a screenie from 0.23:
Pretty sure Tanuki_chau's advert on KSPTV uses that camera angle, so it has been done before.
I have a few of these tucked into the Kerdoz command pod. Any internal space collider can be set to be a camera transform, and you can pan around to get a look at the entire interior.
